DomainData.MainInfoText: Cookies are used to store or retrieve information from your browser (such as Chrome) or device (computer or phone). This information may be about you, your preferences, your device or your settings and is used to allow our website to work and ensure the security of our site. It also helps add functionality and improve your experience, offering a personalised experience and ensuring ads are relevant to you. You can exercise your rights over some categories of cookies below. You may also be able to block the use of Cookies through your browser. For more information, please see our Privacy & Cookie Policy.
DomainData.AlertNoticeText:
Cookies help us to ensure our site works securely, continually make improvements, and personalise your shopping experience.

Click ‘Accept All’ to get the best shopping experience. You can change these settings at any time by clicking ‘Manually Manage Cookies’ below.

For more information, please see our Privacy & Cookie Policy.
DomainData.CookieListDescription: A cookie is a small piece of data (text file) that a website – when visited by a user – asks your browser to store on your device in order to remember information about you, such as your language preference or login information. Those cookies are set by us and called first-party cookies. We also use third-party cookies – which are cookies from a domain different than the domain of the website you are visiting – for our advertising and marketing efforts. More specifically, we use cookies and other tracking technologies for the following purposes:

Groups.GroupDescription: These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks. They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on other websites you visit. If you do not allow these cookies you may not be able to use or see these sharing tools.
Groups.GroupDescriptionOTT: These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks. They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on other websites you visit. If you do not allow these cookies you may not be able to use or see these sharing tools.

Groups.GroupDescription:
Green means on. Grey means off. Grey (Left) means off. Green (Right) means on.Grey (Left) means off. Pink (Right) means on.Grey (Left) means off. Black (Right) means on.Grey (Left) means off. Blue (Right) means on. Targeted cookies are linked to services provided by our trusted partners. These cookies are placed by our trusted advertising and marketing partners (including social networks). These help us to build an understanding of your interests (for example by understanding what products you have browsed on our site) and show you products, services and advertisements relevant to you. These cookies make it possible for us to ensure that you don’t see irrelevant, duplicate or multiple ads from us in a short period of time. We do want to prevent ads continuously re-appearing and annoying you.

You can turn these cookies off. However, you will still see random non targeted advertisements from us online and on social media. These ads will be less relevant, and you may see more adverts. You will also continue to receive a personalised experience on this website and (if you are subscribed) in our Email Marketing.

These help us to build an understanding of your interests (for example by understanding what products you have browsed on our site) and show you products, services and advertisements relevant to you. These cookies make it possible for us to ensure that you don’t see irrelevant, duplicate or multiple ads from us in a short period of time. We do want to prevent ads continuously re-appearing and annoying you.

You can turn these cookies off. However, you will still see random non targeted advertisements from us online and on social media. These ads will be less relevant, and you may see more adverts. You will also continue to receive a personalised experience on this website and (if you are subscribed) in our Email Marketing.

Cookies.description: This domain is owned by Facebook, which is the world's largest social networking service. As a third party host provider, it mostly collects data on the interests of users via widgets such as the 'Like' button found on many websites.  This is used to serve targeted advertising to its users when logged into its services.  In 2014 it also started serving up behaviourally targeted advertising on other websites, similar to most dedicated online marketing companies.
Cookies.thirdPartyDescription: This domain is owned by Facebook, which is the world's largest social networking service. As a third party host provider, it mostly collects data on the interests of users via widgets such as the 'Like' button found on many websites. In 2014 it also started serving up behaviourally targeted advertising on other websites, similar to most dedicated online marketing companies.

These cookies are placed by Next and are used to help us to build an understanding of your interests (for example by understanding what products you have browsed on our site) and show you products, services and advertisements relevant to you whilst you are on the Next Website. These cookies make it possible for us to personalise your experience on this website and (if you are subscribed) in our Email Marketing. There are a number of functional cookies within this category, these cookies enable enhanced functionality on our site, such as allowing you to add to favourites or saving your items for later.

Blue (Right) means on. These cookies allow us to monitor visitors to our site and ensure it is performing correctly. We use this information to measure overall performance, improve your site experience and improve the design of our site. These cookies don’t collect any information that could identify you - all information collected by these cookies is anonymous. You can find more details on these cookies below.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: dtPC
FirstPartyCookies.description:
This cookie name is associated with, software from Dynatrace, an application performance management (APM) software company.
Their software manages the availability and performance of software applications and the impact on user experience in the form of deep transaction tracing, synthetic monitoring, real user monitoring, and network monitoring.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: dtSa
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is used to save action names across pages so that performance can be monitored across pages.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: FPID
FirstPartyCookies.description: A cookie from Google that stores a value used for setting the Client ID in the request to Google’s servers for the purpose of web analytics.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _ga_xxxxxxxxxx
FirstPartyCookies.description: To generate statistical data on how the visitor uses the Service
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: To generate statistical data on how the visitor uses the Service

FirstPartyCookies.Name: rxvt
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is used to store two timestamps to determine session length and the end of a session.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: dtCookie
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Dynatrace to allow us to monitor activity within our network/infrastructure, deep tracing between user endpoints and detection of transmission errors/faults, which could stop the site from functioning.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Dynatrace to allow us to monitor activity within our network/infrastructure, deep tracing between user endpoints and detection of transmission errors/faults, which could stop the site from functioning.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: rxVisitor
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is used to store an anonymous ID for the user to correlate across sessions on the world service.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _br_mt_search
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Bloomreach to leverage caching functionality to improve the speed of our site search
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Bloomreach to leverage caching functionality to improve the speed of our site search

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _ga
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Google Universal Analytics to distinguish unique users by assigning a randomly generated number as a client identifier. It is included in each page request in a site and used to calculate visitor, session and campaign data for the sites analytics reports.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Google Universal Analytics to distinguish unique users by assigning a randomly generated number as a client identifier. It is included in each page request in a site and used to calculate visitor, session and campaign data for the sites analytics reports.

FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Dynatrace to allow us to monitor activity within our network/infrastructure, deep tracing between user endpoints and detection of transmission errors/faults, which could stop the site from functioning.

FirstPartyCookies.description: This is a cookie utilised by Microsoft Bing Ads and is a tracking cookie. It allows us to engage with a user that has previously visited our website.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _gat_UA-
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Google Analytics as a pattern type cookie where the name contains the unique identity number of the account or website it relates to. It appears to be a variation of the _gat cookie which is used to limit the amount of data recorded by Google on high traffic volume websites.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _ga_xxxxxxx
FirstPartyCookies.description: Google Analytics cookie that is used to distinguish unique users by assigning a randomly generated number as a client identifier. The "xxxxxxx" part of the cookie name represents a unique alphanumeric string that is generated by Google Analytics for each individual website.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Google Analytics cookie that is used to distinguish unique users by assigning a randomly generated number as a client identifier. Groups.GroupDescription: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are used, for example, to make sure your transaction is secure, to enable you to log in to the secure areas of your account, such as your order history and to add items to your basket.  Blocking these cookies through your browser may mean that some parts of our site won’t work. It is not currently possible to turn these cookies off, but you can find more details on these cookies below.
Groups.GroupDescriptionOTT: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are used, for example, to make sure your transaction is secure, to enable you to log in to the secure areas of your account, such as your order history and to add items to your basket.  Blocking these cookies through your browser may mean that some parts of our site won’t work. It is not currently possible to turn these cookies off, but you can find more details on these cookies below.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: NSC_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Citrix Netscaler load balancing service. This is a pattern type cookie with the root being NSC_ and the rest of the name being a unique encrypted alpha numeric identifier for the virtual server it originated from. The cookie is used to ensure traffic and user data is routed to the correct locations where a site is hosted on multiple servers, so that the end user has a consistent experience.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Citrix Netscaler load balancing service. This is a pattern type cookie with the root being NSC_ and the rest of the name being a unique encrypted alpha numeric identifier for the virtual server it originated from. The cookie is used to ensure traffic and user data is routed to the correct locations where a site is hosted on multiple servers, so that the end user has a consistent experience.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: akaas_MEGANAV_2022_PD
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Akamai to help create the navigation menus on the site.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Akamai to help create the navigation menus on the site.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: OptUCMOnsiteConsent
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Next to control functional feature cookies.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Next to control functional feature cookies.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: FPLC
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is associated with sites using Google Tag Manager to load other scripts and code into a page.  Where it is used it may be regarded as Strictly Necessary as without it, other scripts may not function correctly. Specifically this cookie is a cross-domain linker hashed from the FPID cookie.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: This cookie is associated with sites using Google Tag Manager to load other scripts and code into a page.  Where it is used it may be regarded as Strictly Necessary as without it, other scripts may not function correctly. Specifically this cookie is a cross-domain linker hashed from the FPID cookie.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: __RequestVerificationToken_
FirstPartyCookies.description: This is an anti-forgery cookie set by web applications built using ASP.NET MVC technologies. It is designed to stop unauthorised posting of content to a website, known as Cross-Site Request Forgery. It holds no information about the user and is destroyed on closing the browser.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: This is an anti-forgery cookie set by web applications built using ASP.NET MVC technologies. It is designed to stop unauthorised posting of content to a website, known as Cross-Site Request Forgery. It holds no information about the user and is destroyed on closing the browser.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: NextVisitor
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Next to identify the user on a device so that the shopping Bag can be remembered
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Next to identify the user on a device so that the shopping Bag can be remembered

FirstPartyCookies.Name: QueueITAccepted-SDFrts345E-V3_nextiemainsitelive
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Queue-it to control website traffic surges and prevent the site from being overwhelmed and crashing.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Queue-it to control website traffic surges and prevent the site from being overwhelmed and crashing.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: NextDeviceType
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Next to identify the users device type, either Mobile or desktop in order to display content which is appropriate for their device.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Next to identify the users device type, either Mobile or desktop in order to display content which is appropriate for their device.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: bm_sz
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Akamai BotManager to spot and avert the most evasive threats and protect the site against malicious users.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Akamai BotManager to spot and avert the most evasive threats and protect the site against malicious users.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: OptanonConsent
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is set by the cookie compliance solution from OneTrust. It stores information about the categories of cookies the site uses and whether visitors have given or withdrawn consent for the use of each category. This enables site owners to prevent cookies in each category from being set in the users browser, when consent is not given. The cookie has a normal lifespan of one year, so that returning visitors to the site will have their preferences remembered. It contains no information that can identify the site visitor.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: PIM-SESSION-ID
FirstPartyCookies.description: Used by Akamai Page Integrity Manager to provide security to help identify suspicious and malicious JavaScript behaviour, potential vulnerabilities, and any script activities that violate policies. This cookie will identify your unique session on the website to communicate with servers.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription: Used by Akamai Page Integrity Manager to provide security to help identify suspicious and malicious JavaScript behaviour, potential vulnerabilities, and any script activities that violate policies. This cookie will identify your unique session on the website to communicate with servers.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: OptanonAlertBoxClosed
FirstPartyCookies.description: This cookie is set by websites using certain versions of the cookie law compliance solution from OneTrust.  It is set after visitors have seen a cookie information notice and in some cases only when they actively close the notice down.  It enables the website not to show the message more than once to a user.  The cookie has a one year lifespan and contains no personal information.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: _abck
FirstPartyCookies.description:
Used by Akamai Bot Manager for the protection/security of our sites, prevention of automated cyber attacks and to protect our customers from Fraud and the unauthorised disclosure of customer PII.
The Cookie is used to identify "good" Humans by the Bot and remember them so as to reduce the risk of us incorrectly blocking a known good customer when they return to the site.
The recommended duration is set by our partners to reduce the risk of false positives, help identify legitimate customers so we don't inadvertently block them from their account.
FirstPartyCookies.thirdPartyDescription:
Used by Akamai Bot Manager for the protection/security of our sites, prevention of automated cyber attacks and to protect our customers from Fraud and the unauthorised disclosure of customer PII.
The Cookie is used to identify "good" Humans by the Bot and remember them so as to reduce the risk of us incorrectly blocking a known good customer when they return to the site.
The recommended duration is set by our partners to reduce the risk of false positives, help identify legitimate customers so we don't inadvertently block them from their account.

FirstPartyCookies.Name: ASP.NET_SessionId
FirstPartyCookies.description: General purpose platform session cookie, used by sites written with Miscrosoft .NET based technologies. Usually used to maintain an anonymised user session by the server.
